viable.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully
viable.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The committee came forward with one viable solution.
Will a hotel here be financially viable?
viable.translation[0].definitions[1].def: able to continue to live or to develop into a living thing
viable.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: New projects must be economically viable.
We want to make public transport a viable alternative to using cars.
Moving the company was not a viable option.
Is this kind of tourism a viable proposition?
Perhaps the only viable solution is to merge the hospitals.
He turned the farm into a viable business.
viable.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a viable plan, system, suggestion etc is realistic and therefore may succeed
viable.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: We had two months to come up with aviable proposal for saving the factory.
If investors find that approach viable, there are no rules to stop them doing that.
viable.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a viable company or organization is making a profit and can continue to do business
viable.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: We had to reduce staff to survive as a viable firm.
The auditors will decide whether or not the bank iseconomically viable.
